title: is using a VM to run 2 instances of LoL simultaneously bannable?
body: So I have seen a bunch of Reddit threads of people using VM software to be able to run multiple instances of LoL simultaneously so multiple people can play league on the same computer at the same time; I was curious if this was bannable given Riot's somewhat vague "3rd party software" policies. It would be used so 2 people can play sharing the same computer using their own sets of mice and keyboards.

replies.body: How would this be bannable? It's effectively the same as two people sitting next to each other on two separate computers.

> [{quoted}](name=kattzkitti,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=IE3dxmW4,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2017-10-22T06:52:52.268+0000)
>
> How would this be bannable? It's effectively the same as two people sitting next to each other on two separate computers.

it can be bannable, since, in the past there have been people who have used a VM with botting programs which ic againest the TOS.

the problem with a VM is that riot cannot prove without being behind the players that there are two players playing at the same time or if its one player controlling a botted account to boost and sell which is also a bannable offence.

I'd steer clear of this for a couple reasons. First, I'm honestly not entirely sure if VM software would be detected as possibly malicious third-party software or not. This is actually most likely how people bot accounts if I had to guess.

The second and more important reason, playing two sets of League on the same PC might not work so well performance wise.
